alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ascension; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:46PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. John The Baptist, northeastern Ascension, northeastern St. James, northwestern St. Charles and south central Livingston Parishes through 315 PM CDT... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Whitehall to Hahnville. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reserve, Hahnville, Laplace, Sorrento, French Settlement, Port Vincent, Killona, Norco, Montz, Edgard, Garyville, Boutte, Destrehan, Taft, New Sarpy, Whitehall and Luling. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 188 and 211. Interstate 12 near mile marker 19. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 310 between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ascension; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension
